thread.title: Moravian Academy boys soccer edges Southern Lehigh in Colonial League semis
thread.title_full: Moravian Academy boys soccer edges Southern Lehigh in Colonial League semis

title: Moravian Academy boys soccer edges Southern Lehigh in Colonial League semis
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Moravian Academy 1, Southern Lehigh 0 – Rapid Recap 
Moravian Academy’s boys soccer team moved a step closer to successfully defending its Colonial League title by defeating Southern Lehigh 1-0 in the league semifinals on Tuesday at Salisbury High School. 
Turning point : Moravian Academy (16-2-1) got the evening started with a lightning bolt. Phil Astolfi ran onto a ball cleared out of the Southern Lehigh box and laced a low laser that left goalkeeper Torin Vanin motionless, and gave the Lions a 1-0 lead about 8 minutes into the first half. 
Top performer : Astolfi had the game’s best (and only) finish while also exhibiting a good work rate. Teammate Jack Painter, however, was the most dangerous player throughout the course of the evening against the Spartans (11-8). 
Painter tested Vanin throughout the contest and also had the game’s best pass in the second half when he picked out Nic Lozano, whose header was wide. 
What it means : The Lions advance to defend their league championship in Thursday’s 7 p.m. final against Northwestern at a site to be determined. Northwestern handed Moravian Academy its only league loss of the regular season in a decisive 3-0 result on Oct. 5. 
The Lions get an opportunity for payback on a big stage.
